extendedIngredients.name: navel oranges
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 medium navel oranges, peeled and sectioned

extendedIngredients.name: red onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small red onion, sliced and separated into rings

recipes.title: Orange 'n' Red Onion Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Salad can be paired with Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Buddha Kat Winery Chardonnay with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 25 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Buddha Kat Winery Chardonnay
productMatches.description: We barrel ferment our Chardonnay and age it in a mix of Oak and Stainless. Giving this light bodied wine modest oak character, a delicate floral aroma, and a warming finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                On a serving platter, arrange the romaine, oranges and onion. In a small bowl, whisk the remaining ingredients; drizzle over salad.                                        Yield: 4 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Orange 'n' Red Onion Salad in  Taste of HomeDecember/January 2006, p35                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (1 cup) equals 173 calories, 14 g fat (2 g saturated fat), 0 cholesterol, 153 mg sodium, 13 g carbohydrate, 3 g fiber, 2 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: On a serving platter, arrange the romaine, oranges and onion. In a small bowl, whisk the remaining ingredients; drizzle over salad.
